required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Retinal and Vascular Features in Macular Degeneration After Intravitreal Injections of Bevacizumab
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Retinal and Vascular Features by Optical Coherence Tomography and Optical Coherence Tomography Angiography After Intravitreal Injections of Bevacizumab in Exudative Age-related Macular Degeneration

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the retinal and vascular features in patients with macular degeneration under the effects of Bevacizumab intravitreal injections using optical coherence tomography and optical coherence tomography angiography.

detailed_description.textblock:
Bevacizumab is a vascular endothelial growth factor antagonist represent an efficacy treatment for exudative age-related macular degeneration acting on vascular hyperpermeability.
The optical coherence tomography and optical coherence tomography angiography represent novel and non-invasive diagnostic techniques that allow a detailed and quantitative analysis of retinal and vascular features.
The study evaluates the changes in optical coherence tomography and optical coherence tomography angiography parameters at baseline and after three monthly injections of Bevacizumab in exudative AMD.

primary_outcome.measure: Study of retinal structural features in exudative age-related macular degeneration after intravitreal injections of Bevacizumab
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of Bevacizumab injections for treating exudative age-related macular degeneration using optical coherence tomography. The parameters analyzed by optical coherence tomography: Central Macular Thickness and Subfoveal Choroidal thickness (microns).

primary_outcome.measure: Study of retinal vascular features in exudative age-related macular degeneration after intravitreal injections of Bevacizumab
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of Bevacizumab injections for treating exudative age-related macular degeneration using optical coherence tomography angiography. The parameters analyzed by optical coherence tomography angiography were: retinal and choriocapillaris vessel density (%).

arm_group.description: Bevacizumab, intravitreal injection, three monthly, dosage: 1.25 mg/0.05 mL.

intervention.description: Three monthly intravitreal injections of bevacizumab (1.25 mg/0.05 mL)

study_pop.textblock: The participans were older than 50 years with diagnosis of exudative age-relative macular degeneration. They did not present other ophthalmological disease and did not receive previous treatment before Bevacizumab.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age older than 50 years, diagnosis of exudative age-related macular degeneration, treatment-na√Øve with Bevacizumab for exudative age-related macular degeneration.
Exclusion Criteria:
- age younger than 50 years, diagnosis of exudative macular degeneration due to other causes, previous treatments before Bevacizumab for exudative age-related macular degeneration.
